headline.main: Running the Numbers: Controlling Labor Costs

docs.abstract: Should I pay people what they deserve - or just enough so that they don't leave? It's easy to let payroll get out of control and suck up all of the profit in the company.
docs.snippet: Should I pay people what they deserve - or just enough so that they don't leave? It's easy to let payroll get out of control and suck up all of the profit in the company.

docs.lead_paragraph: I don't keep close track of the hours I spend at work, never have, and probably never will. I have, in the past, worked fairly long hours, but I rarely exceed 60 hours a week. Most days, I work about 10 hours, but I'm not what you would call a steady worker - too many things to distract me, and no one looking over my shoulder. My people, though, work very hard and very steadily.

docs.snippet: The Times is tracking donors to “super PACs” as they filed regular reports with the Federal Election Commission.

docs.lead_paragraph: The plight of people who are now unable to pay for screening tests underscores the need to retain the health care reform law to help pay for preventive care.
docs.abstract: Editorial on federal study findings that Americans are getting screened for three major cancers--breast, cervical and colorectal-- at rates far below national targets; contends that plight of Americans who are now unable to pay for cancer screening tests underscores the need to retain the health care reform law to help pay for preventive care.
docs.snippet: The plight of people who are now unable to pay for screening tests underscores the need to retain the health care reform law to help pay for preventive care.

docs.lead_paragraph: Signature Theater Company’s new home is one of the most ambitious new cultural complexes in New York in decades.

headline.seo: Signature Theater Opens New Home in a Frank Gehry Building

docs.abstract: Signature Theater Company opens its new complex on West 42nd Street; artistic director James Houghton was able to realize the ambitious project during an economic downturn with the help of true believers including the actor Edward Norton.
docs.snippet: Signature Theater Company’s new home is one of the most ambitious new cultural complexes in New York in decades.

docs.lead_paragraph: Rick Santorum, a Republican presidential candidate, stayed off the campaign trail to be with his daughter Isabella, who received a diagnosis of Trisomy 18, a chromosomal disorder, at birth.

headline.seo: Illness of Rick Santorum’s Daughter, 3, Tests the Candidate
headline.main: Santorum Daughter’s Illness a Test for Candidate
headline.print_headline: Daughter’s Illness Is a Constant Challenge, and a Rallying Point, for Santorum

docs.abstract: Republican presidential candidate Rick Santorum stays off the campaign trail in Florida temporarily to be with his 3-year-old daughter Isabella, who suffers from chromosomal disorder Trisomy 18, after she came down with pneumonia; her health issues remain a constant challenge for Santorum, who struggles to balance his time and energy between his family and his campaign.
docs.snippet: Rick Santorum, a Republican presidential candidate, stayed off the campaign trail to be with his daughter Isabella, who received a diagnosis of Trisomy 18, a chromosomal disorder, at birth.

byline.contributor: Pam Belluck contributed reporting from New York City.
byline.original: By KATHARINE Q. SEELYE and SUSAN SAULNY

docs.lead_paragraph: With declining insurance reimbursements, more doctors are expanding their practices to include things like breast augmentation and liposuction paid for out-of-pocket by patients.

headline.seo: Non-Specialists Expand Into Lucrative Cosmetic Surgery Procedures
headline.main: Ear Doctors Performing Face-Lifts? It Happens
headline.print_headline: Ear Doctors Performing Face-Lifts? It Happens

docs.abstract: More doctors are expanding their practices to include procedures like breast augmentation and liposuction as their insurance reimbursements decline; cosmetic surgeries are more profitable for doctors because they are paid for out-of-pocket; certified plastic surgeons contend that trend is producing an increasing number of dissatisfied, and even disfigured, patients.
docs.snippet: With declining insurance reimbursements, more doctors are expanding their practices to include things like breast augmentation and liposuction paid for out-of-pocket by patients.

docs.lead_paragraph: If New York City's licensing test for home improvement contractors were given in Chinese and included the finer points of bamboo scaffolding, contractors like Gary Lin, 42, of Queens would breathe much easier taking it. Mr. Lin worked on bamboo platforms while working in construction in Changle, his home city in the Chinese province of Fujian. Now, despite speaking very limited English, he is trying to start a legitimate home improvement company in Flushing, which is rife with unlicensed contractors.

headline.main: Helping Under-the-Table Chinese Contractors Get Right With the Law

docs.abstract: City Room blog; Queens Economic Development Corporation is offering class aimed at familiarizing immigrant contractors with New York City's licensing test for home improvement; countless immigrant, especially Chinese, contractors are performing home improvement projects without a city license. Photo (M)o

byline.original: By COREY KILGANNON and JEFFREY E. SINGER

headline.main: The End of Health Insurance Companies

docs.abstract: Accountable care organizations will shift the focus of medicine away from treating sickness and toward keeping patients healthy.
docs.snippet: Accountable care organizations will shift the focus of medicine away from treating sickness and toward keeping patients healthy.

byline.original: By EZEKIEL J. EMANUEL and JEFFREY B. LIEBMAN

docs.lead_paragraph: Here's a bold prediction for the new year. By 2020, the American health insurance industry will be extinct. Insurance companies will be replaced by accountable care organizations - groups of doctors, hospitals and other health care providers who come together to provide the full range of medical care for patients.

headline.main: The End of Health Insurance Companies

docs.abstract: Accountable care organizations will shift the focus of medicine away from treating sickness and toward keeping patients healthy.
docs.snippet: Accountable care organizations will shift the focus of medicine away from treating sickness and toward keeping patients healthy.
